newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX Hub natgas mostly ends higher on late rally.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX Hub natgas mostly ends higher on late rally.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures mostly ended near session highs Friday in fairly active trade, driven by a late wave of technical buying and short covering when some key points were breached, market sources said.

June rallied 8.9 cents to close at $2.285 per million British thermal units after dipping to $2.185 on the open. July settled seven cents higher at $2.294. Other months ended mixed, with some 1999s down slightly.
"Once we broke $2.25 (basis June), the locals went after the shorts and hit some (buy) stops," said a Midwest trader. NYMEX is closed Monday for the U.S. Memorial Day holiday.
But despite the sharp move higher and more bullish technical picture, many remained skeptical current levels can be sustained, with little heating or cooling load forecast right into early June.
"The shorts got squeezed, but I think futures have disassociated from cash. If you look at the weather, there's no demand anywhere," said one East Coast trader.

Revised 6-10 day forecasts released Friday were still calling for normal to slightly below-normal weather for most of the nation, with above-normal temperatures expected only in the Northwest and parts of the Southeast.

Technical traders said the market was still range-bound though another run at resistance was expected early next week. They still pegged June support and resistance at $2.15 and $2.30, respectively. Major buying was likely at the $2.05 double bottom and good selling expected at the $2.43 contract high.

In the cash, Gulf Coast weekend prices eased slightly to the $2.14-2.19 area. Midcon pipes were off a few cents to the high-$1.90s. New York city gate weekend gas also was down slightly to the low-$2.40s.

Planned work on Mobil's Mary Ann gas processing plant in Coden, Ala., has cut the plant's total processing capacity of 380-390 mmcfd. About 120 mmcfd should be back by early next week, with the balance due back in about two weeks.
The NYMEX Henry Hub 12-month strip jumped 5.5 cents to $2.319. NYMEX Henry Hub volume was unavailable late Friday.

On the KCBT, June finished 6.5 cents higher at $2.11, while deferreds ended up by four to 5.5 cents. The East/West spread widened by 2.4 cents to 17.5 cents (NYMEX premium). KCBT said 825 lots traded, up from Thursday's total of 367.
